constitutionalAuthorityStatementText:
[Congressional Record Volume 167, Number 85 (Monday, May 17, 2021)]
[House]
From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]
By Mr. McHENRY:
H.R. 3281.
Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuant
to the following:
Article I, Section 8, Clause 3: ``To regulate Commerce with
foreign nations, and among the several states, and with the
Indian Tribes.'' Because the federal government has extended
Article I, Section 8, Clause 3 beyond its intended
boundaries, it follows that efforts to rein in excessive
federal government encroachment in this area can be justified
by Article I, Section 8, Clause 3.
[Page H2421]

latestAction.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Environment and Climate Change.

title: RPM Act of 2019
